main event: Two weather observers at the Brest Meteorological Station in Brest, France observed a luminous, triangular-shaped object in the sky on April 18, 1963.
interesting points: The object was first seen at an azimuth of 280 degrees and an elevation of 20 degrees.
The object moved slowly from west to east, maintaining a constant altitude.
After a few minutes, the object stopped and hovered for about 5 minutes, then resumed its eastward movement and disappeared from sight.
The object appeared to be triangular in shape and was luminous, with a reddish-orange color.
No sound was heard from the object.
witnesses: two weather observers at the Brest Meteorological Station
